model
Interface Port

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPort, FemoopDiscrete.ElemSetProvidesPort, FemoopDiscrete.NodeSetProvidesPort, FemoopNumerical.ElemMatSetProvidesPort, FemoopNumerical.IndVecProvidesPort, ModelDriver.UsesPort, ProvidesPort
public interface Port

Interface used to define classes that manipulate simulation data which are exchanged between models. Every Datatype object is always passed by reference. The Datatype interface serves to identify objects whose methods may be invoked from a non-local simulation session. Any object that is a remote object must directly or indirectly implement this interface. Only those methods specified in a "remote interface", an interface that extends Datatype are available remotely.

A port should provide a constructor that specifies the number of terms of each block of the iterator. A zero value for the number of blocks indicates that no blocks will be created by the iterator. A negative value indicates that the number of terms in a block is computed automatically. Otherwise, a positive value indicates that the iteration is performed by blocks. The nextTerm iterates in this block while it has a term to be iterated.

In addition, this interface defines a couple of methods to

Implementation classes can implement any number of remote interfaces and can extend other remote implementation classes. Forr� provides some convenience classes that remote object implementations can extend which facilitate remote object creation. These classes are AbstractDatatype.

Author:
Ricardo Corr�a (correa@lia.ufc.br)

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the instance's name.

Returns:
a string containing the name of this instance.

isUses

boolean isUses()
Return true if this object extends UsesPort, which means that it contains remotely callable methods. If it returns false, then this object extends ProvidesPort, and only local method invocations are allowed.

Returns:
true if this object is remote.

isProvides

boolean isProvides()
Return true if this object extends ProvidesPort, which means that only local method invocations are allowed. If it returns false, then this object extends UsesPort, and it contains remotely callable methods.

Returns:
true if this object is local.

toArray

Datatype toArray()
Returns an array containing all of the elements in this collection. If the collection makes any guarantees as to what order its elements are returned by its iterator, this method must return the elements in the same order.

The returned array will be "safe" in that no references to it are maintained by this collection. (In other words, this method must allocate a new array even if this collection is backed by an array). The caller is thus free to modify the returned array.

This method acts as bridge between array-based and collection-based APIs.

Returns:
a Datatype object whose getContents method returns an AbstractDatatypeArray containing all of the elements in this collection

startIterator

Datatype startIterator()
The implementation of this method depends on the result of isUses. If it returns true, then the implementation should get the values according to the data transfer policy of the link associated with the binding of this port. Otherwise, the implementation should send the values according to the mentioned data transfer policy. This means that the next method returns arrays of elements.

Returns:
an identifier for the iterator of the view of a model corresponding to this port.

nextTerm

Datatype nextTerm(Datatype iteratorId)
Iterates on this set view. If a block exists and is not already completely iterated, then the next term is picked up in this block. Otherwise, the next term comes from the model component.

Parameters:
iteratorId - the identification of a previously started iterator
Returns:
if the invocation iteratorId.equals(i) returns true for some identification i, then returns the next element on the iterator i; otherwise returns null

hasNextTerm

boolean hasNextTerm(Datatype iteratorId)
If there is a block, checks for a next term in the block. If it return false in this case, the block is released. If there is no block, checks for a next term in the model component.

The non-blocking behavior is given by the packed iteration principle

Parameters:
iteratorId - the identification of a previously started iterator
Returns:
if the invocation iteratorId.equals(i) returns true for some i, then returns whether the iterator i has a next element; otherwise returns null

getTerm

Datatype getTerm(Datatype key)
Gets a term associated with a specified key.

Parameters:
key - of the map view.
Returns:
the value associated with the specified key.

getTerm

Datatype getTerm()
Gets a term with a default property.

Returns:
the term chosen according to a default property specified by the implementation of this interface

             Datatype term)
Inserts a specified term associated with a specified key.

Parameters:
key - the key associated to the term to be inserted
term - a term to be inserted to this

size

int size()
The number of terms returned by the iterator.

Returns:
the size of this view

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Indicates if there are at least one term in this view.

Returns:
true if there are no terms in this and false otherwise

tailTerms

void tailTerms(Datatype d)
Keeps all terms that are greater than the specified value according to the order defined on the terms of this view.

Parameters:
d - the value used for the pruning comparison. It must implement the Comparable interface.
